block.p: Amanda Michelle Hayman, the daughter of Linda C. Hayman of New York, was married yesterday to William Francis McGovern II, the son of Mary Lynne and Kenneth W. McGovern of Shaker Heights, Ohio. The Rev. Barnabas J. Keck, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Shady Methodist Church in Shady, N.Y. The Rev. Harriette Zoller, a Methodist minister, took part in the service.

Later this month, Mrs. McGovern, 26, is to begin her third year of law school at the University of Virginia in Charlottesville. She graduated magna cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania. Her mother is a partner in the New York law firm of Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom.

Amanda Michelle Hayman, the daughter of Linda C. Hayman of New York, was married yesterday to William Francis McGovern II, the son of Mary Lynne and Kenneth W. McGovern of Shaker Heights, Ohio. The Rev. Barnabas J. Keck, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Shady Methodist Church in Shady, N.Y. The Rev. Harriette Zoller, a Methodist minister, took part in the service.

Later this month, Mrs. McGovern, 26, is to begin her third year of law school at the University of Virginia in Charlottesville. She graduated magna cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania. Her mother is a partner in the New York law firm of Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom.

Mr. McGovern, 34, is a staff lawyer in the enforcement division of the Securities and Exchange Commission in Washington. He graduated from Penn and Temple University Law School. His father is an urban development consultant in Cleveland. His mother is an academic counselor at Shaker Heights High School.
